Welcome to simulatetraj's documentation!¶

Using simulatetraj, initial value problems can be solved numerically. In the backend, adaptive numerical integration using backward difference formula/Adam Moulton Bashfort method is performed using CVODES from the SUNDIALS suite. The implementation solely relies on CasADi's integrator class in the backend.

Given initial state \(x(t_0)=x_0\) and control inputs \(u(t)\) on \(t \in [t_0,t_f]\), the state trajectory \(x(t)\) is computed for the explicit differential equation \(\dot{x}=f(x,u,t,p)\).

Symbol

Description

Dimensions

\(x(t)\)

State vector

\(\mathbb{R}^{n_x}\)

\(u(t)\)

Control vector

\(\mathbb{R}^{n_u}\)

\(p\)

Parameter vector

\(\mathbb{R}^{n_p}\)

\(t\)

time

\(\mathbb{R}^{1}\)
